trouble with the resolution of
cliffhangers is that it's extremely
difficult to meet or exceed audience
expectations the first part of the story
can focus on breaking everything apart
and building to a massive question mark
in this story which is fun and exciting
while the second part has the unenviable
task of laborious ly putting everything
back together again sometimes this can
be a bit dry or possibly even boring the
issue with cliffhanger resolutions is
that they're very very easy to get wrong
and can often become predictable
paint-by-numbers Affairs the reason for
this is because the audience knows that
the universe has to be put back together
the way it was the trap that writers can
fall into is turning the second part
into the opposite of the first part it's
far easier more fun and entertaining for
the writers to set up a major dramatic
earth-shattering cliffhanger in the
first part but it's much less compelling
to watch it all being put back together
and undone or fixed up in the second
part satisfying cliffhanger payoffs are
very tough to achieve worst case
scenario if a cliffhanger conclusion is
done wrong the writers can lazily fall
back on the tired trope of everything
was a dream though I very much doubt
that's how avengers endgame will resolve
the cliffhanger set up in infinity war
everyone remembers Star Trek the next
generations best of both
world's for the first part of the
two-parter the second part while a fine
episode is generally not remembered
anywhere near as fondly because
restoring the status quo is not as fun
to watch as seeing the status quo
smashed to pieces this is the reason i
very much doubt avengers endgame will be
able to match the intensity and
excitement level of infinity war the
memorable and shocking conclusion of the
Thanos snap which saw half of all life
wiped out across the universe and a huge
chunk of the Avengers superheroes
reduced to dust well that was a massive
moment and the fans speculation as to
how it's going to be resolved has been
rife for the past year with endless
theories circulating across the web
there is however a new theory that I
thought was worth some attention because
it may represent a possible explanation
that's been hidden in plain sight
since the infinity war trailers were
first released this is a theory proposed
by a Reddit user by the name of u /big
martin 58 and numerous publications have
picked up on this theory of the past
couple of days I'll include a link to
his full explanation in the description
box below the theory draws on some
notable disparities between the infinity
war trailer and the actual infinity war
film first of all most Marvel fans will
be familiar with this running scene
prominently featuring war machine Bucky
Captain America Black Widow Black
Panther and the Hulk
of course the Hulk only appears in the
opening scene of the film and then Bruce
Banner is unable to summon sufficient
amounts of anger to bring the Hulk back
during the rest of the film the main
theory being that the battering the Hulk
received from Thanos in the beginning of
the movie had scared him into submission
so instead Bruce Banner makes use of a
giant Iron Man suit
provided by Tony Stark however for some
reason the Hulk appears in this shot
from what looks like a moment from the
end battle at Wakanda it's even
suggested that this may have been a
deleted scene or possibly some early or
temporary CGI that was later dropped
from the film because the filmmakers
decided to shift gears with the
direction of the Hulk's character
however think about this for a moment it
would be very strange for the FX guys
and Digital Wizards to throw in the Hulk
here given that there were very
important
reasons why he doesn't appear in most of
the film and by that I mean despite his
trouncing by thanos in the opening scene
it's obvious that the Hulk represents
the biggest physical threat to Thanos of
all of the Avengers I believe he was
conveniently left out of most of the
fighting in the movie for that very
reason the Hulk will without doubt play
a massive role in endgame and it's no
coincidence that Bruce Banner was one of
the surviving team members we also know
that comic book heroes never truly stay
dead and many of them that bit the dust
in infinity war are due to make future
appearances in the MCU so I'm with the
fans who believe that time travel is
going to play a major role in endgame
the theory going around at the moment is
that this running shot featuring Hulk in
the background is actually not some
deleted scene from infinity war but is
in fact from endgame where presumably
the characters have gone back in time to
the Wakanda fight scene slightly before
the Thanos showdown and the Hulk has
finally got his mojo back this would
also explain the presence of Bucky and
black panther who as you know both
perished at the end of the previous film
so maybe the Hulk's presence here is not
an accident or an oversight on the
filmmakers part additionally there's a
very specific shot in the trailer that
differs from the movie in a final fight
between Captain America and fan OHS we
see the Infinity Gauntlet in the trailer
which has two Infinity stones missing
the Power Stone and the space stone but
in the film these stones are already
placed within the gauntlet during this
scene is it possible that in endgame The
Avengers will go back in time and
prevent Thanos from getting his hands on
these two stones in other words the
filmmakers have cleverly made us believe
that some of these shots in the Infinity
war trailer were from infinity war but
they were in fact from endgame of course
this is all just speculation at this
point and it's possible that these
disparities were seeing are simply
unfinished CGI released for the trailers
early incomplete renderings or possibly
a hint that we the audience weren't
initially paying close enough attention
either way we'll know the truth in May
when Avengers endgame hit cinemas I
personally can't see
and game being anything other than a bit
of an anti-climax to be honest that
doesn't mean it won't be a fun popcorn
action film but given that expectations
are insanely and probably unreasonably
high for this film it will likely fail
to match infinity war though it will be
another massive box-office success for
the franchise let me know your thoughts
